title: Performance-Based Curriculum Design for Remote Sensing Image Interpretation

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented training for current professionals, delivered through smartphone-based learning environments

learning_goals: Learners can analyze remotely sensed images acquired from various sensors (satellite/aerial) and identify terrain and feature characteristics with 80% or higher accuracy.
Learners can apply image classification algorithms (hyperspectral/multispectral) to derive land cover classification results and improve errors to below 15%.
Learners can create environmental change monitoring reports using remote sensing data and propose practical solutions to real-world problems.

resources: Mobile-Compatible Image Interpretation Tools (QGIS Mobile, Web-Based ENVI)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
